cyclone.name: BONNIE
cyclone.current_location: about 435 miles SE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest toward the South Carolina coast, then forecast to slow and arc northward across eastern South Carolina and southeastern North Carolina before turning northeast and moving back offshore near the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: South Carolina coast between Savannah River and Little River Inlet

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect (nearest watch/warning is in South Carolina)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Savannah River, GA to Little River Inlet, SC under Tropical Storm Warning
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Georgia coast through South Carolina and into southeastern North Carolina (including Cape Fear area)
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (forecast 2–4 inches with isolated higher amounts)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds (35–45 mph) possible Sunday night into Monday with higher gusts
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation of 1–2 ft possible along the lower Cape Fear coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands with 2–4 inches, locally higher, Sunday night through Monday
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents likely along southeastern North Carolina beaches
